  • Method Details

    • GenerateRandomNumbers

      public void GenerateRandomNumbers(int divisor)
      Generates the random integers that serve as the numbers in an expression. Called in the function GenerateRandomExpression
      Parameters:
      divisor - Tells function whether or not there is an integer division in the expression. 0 means no, 1 means the first operator, 2 means the 2nd operator

    • GenerateRandomExpression

      public List<String> GenerateRandomExpression()
      Function to randomly generate the full expression, including the operators.
      Returns:
      Array (serving as a tuple) where the first element is the result of the expression and the second element is the expression as a String.

    • getExpMap

      public HashMap<String,Integer> getExpMap()
      Getter of the hashmap containing all expressions as keys and results as values.
      Returns:
      HashMap containing all expressions as keys and answers as values.

    • GenerateExpressionList

      public void GenerateExpressionList(int n)
      Function to generate n expressions using the GenerateRandomExpression function.
      Parameters:
      n - An integer n representing how many expressions to generate.
